etymologies: late 18th century. From German Prehnit from the name of Colonel Hendrik Prehn, Dutch commandant at the Cape of Good Hope, who brought specimens of this mineral to Europe + German -it

definitions: A mineral of the orthorhombic crystal system which consists of a hydrated silicate of calcium and aluminium, Ca₂ Al₂ Si₃ O₁₀ (OH)₂, and occurs as pale green, yellowish, or colourless crystals in spherular aggregates, or as vitreous masses.
